Package shopping

Class ShoppingBag

java.lang.Object
shopping.ShoppingBag
public class ShoppingBag
extends java.lang.Object
ShoppingBag is a representation of a bag containing store items (GroceryItems). It contains a GroceryItem array to represent all items, a current size, and a dynamic capacity. Items can be added and removed, and the bag itself can grow in size and capacity when capacity is reached.
Author:
Devin Macalalad, David Gasperini

    private int capacity

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(GroceryItem item)
    Adds specified GroceryItem to the bag array by first checking if it will exceed capacity.
    private int find​(GroceryItem item)
    Iterates through bag array searching for specified GroceryItem.
    int getSize()
    Getter for the private member 'size'.
    private void grow()
    Creates a new bag array with an increased size by 5 and copies all current items into it.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Testbed main method designed to test the methods included in this class
    void print()
    Prints information for all items currently in the bag array via the 'toString' method.
    boolean remove​(GroceryItem item)
    Removes specified GroceryItem from the bag array after searching for it using the 'find' method.
    double salesPrice()
    Iterates over the bag array to sum up the prices for all items.
    double salesTax()
    Iterates over the bag array to sum up the tax amounts for each item by taking the product of the price and tax amount (0.06625).

    • bag

      private GroceryItem[] bag

    • size

      private int size

    • capacity

      private int capacity

  • Constructor Details

    • ShoppingBag

      public ShoppingBag​(int capacity)
      Constructor for a shopping bag object. Sets default values for members.
      Parameters:
      initial - capacity of the shopping bag.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(GroceryItem item)
      Iterates through bag array searching for specified GroceryItem. Compares via 'equals' method.
      Parameters:
      GroceryItem - to be searched for in bag array.
      Returns:
      index of the found GroceryItem in the bag array, -1 if the item was not found.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Creates a new bag array with an increased size by 5 and copies all current items into it. Resets bag member to point to this new array.

    • add

      public void add​(GroceryItem item)
      Adds specified GroceryItem to the bag array by first checking if it will exceed capacity. If so, the 'grow' method is called first.
      Parameters:
      item - GroceryItem to be added to the shopping bag.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(GroceryItem item)
      Removes specified GroceryItem from the bag array after searching for it using the 'find' method.
      Parameters:
      item - GroceryItem to be removed from the shopping bag.
      Returns:
      true was able to remove the item

    • salesPrice

      public double salesPrice()
      Iterates over the bag array to sum up the prices for all items.
      Returns:
      summation of all prices currently in the bag array.

    • salesTax

      public double salesTax()
      Iterates over the bag array to sum up the tax amounts for each item by taking the product of the price and tax amount (0.06625).
      Returns:
      summation of all taxes currently in the bag array.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints information for all items currently in the bag array via the 'toString' method.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Getter for the private member 'size'.
      Returns:
      size of the shopping bag.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Testbed main method designed to test the methods included in this class
